author: Sober24
title: All the changes at wisbech
body: Cgl Wisbech last year was the best place I have ever been for help, the groups were awesome very helpful and the support was great was literally like a family of people in recovery and helping those trying to make that jump. Then something changed just before covid hit town. The groups changed I felt judged and unsupported it became a free for all and our family was no longer there as people stopped coming to the groups. Then came covid. And all of a sudden staff got switched and changed which was hard for me to take as my amazing worker had been with me for years and I needed their support but they were moved. I hate change especially when it's something so important then I started getting phone calls from someone else who I feel is not qualified. Yes they have been through the process but in honesty I think I'm longer sober than they are. I feel like AA is being rammed down my throat every chance they get. I was previously going to AA meetings and this staff member was also. I just think its a conflict of interest and also because it works for one person doesn't mean it works for us all, if I wanted to go to AA I would. I no longer feel supported I feel like I've been put with someone who doesn't have a clue about my situation, doesn't understand and thinks they are doing better than me. I don't know what's going on but I do know it seems that lots of good people have been lost. Having someone who has been through what you have is great but I feel talked down to.

author: novemberdw96
title: Poor communication Nottinghamshire mental health services
body:
In November 2019 I had a counselling session with an organisation called trent pts. After my consultation I was referred to secondary mental health services. I had 3 consultations with a mental health nurse at The Hope Centre in Beeston.  
I was referred to a community psychiatric nurse. I did not get an appointment until January this year 2021 because of the covid outbreak. I have now had to cancel my appointment twice has we have had covid in the house and I unfortunately have got infected.  
The nurse has refused to see me until I get a negative result.  
Why are these meetings not conducted virtually over microsoft teams or zoom!

author: Mourne6
title: Excellent service bay Rapid Access Team in Daisy Hill, Newry
body: My mum had a couple of incidents that it was decided needed to be investigated and she was referred very quickly to the Rapid Access Clinic in Newry. She ended up being there twice and then had a review after being diagnosed as having a couple of TIA's. On every occasion she was dealt with excellently. The staff who dealt with her were patient and reassuring and I was particular impressed when I received a phone call some time later by a pharmacist who was reviewing her medication. All in all it was an excellent service especially considering all this took place in the midst of the covid restrictions.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: lanpatient
title: Adult Mental Health Service
body:
I work for the NHS myself and champion the hard work of my colleagues regularly. However, I really feel we all have a responsibility to identify areas for improvement and areas where risk is not managed. I am really disappointed that I cannot in good faith recommend Adult Mental Health Services. I do not feel it is patient centered or safe.  
I have accessed different resources within Mental Health and the 3rd Sector in attempts to manage my anxiety and depression, desperately trying to keep myself safe and well. My GP has always been a fantastic support and I do feel certain individuals on my journey have understood me, to an extent, and supported me to explore SOME aspects of my mental health and management strategies. Some of the professionals I have encountered very much appeared to have a one size fits all approach and I really struggled with that. Some professionals made careless throwaway comments which were very damaging. Unfortunately, I do not have the recall of all the names involved in my care but I do prefer to address the service as a whole.  
My mind does not work in the same way as most. I struggle to visualise concepts, engage in mindfulness or use ‘grounding’ as so many other factors come into play. In honesty I feel I may present with an Autism Spectrum Disorder also and I am curious as to the different strategies that would be suggested for individuals who have difficulty with imagination, communication, sensory behaviours and rigid thinking alongside their mental health. It becomes nearly impossible to do some of the work suggested and fuels that feeling of ‘failure’ and self-loathing. I feel that some professionals did listen to some of my needs and tried to adapt ideas. However, I honestly feel that this took longer in terms of a therapy process. I feel there are ideas I want to consider but there was no time. But what if considering these with support is what I need?  
Time. That became the issue. I had exceeded the agreed amount of sessions. Not agreed by me, that was never mentioned until near the end of my sessions, but agreed by the service somewhere I presume. This is abhorrent to me. Why was I not involved in decision making initially? Why am I still not? I felt like I was told this is what is happening. How can sessions end when I don’t feel equipt to safely manage my own risk? I have taken a nose dive into hell over the Christmas period and on my last session was lying in darkness, breaking my heart in fear of what I might do to myself. In fear of not being aware of who to get help from. I was told to call the Samaritans? I’m trying to manage a risk with the professional support that has been given to me and I felt worthless. How on earth am I meant to contact a complete stranger? Someone who does not know or understand me? It took huge amounts of energy and trust to access all that I have accessed. The thought of engaging with a stranger about anything terrifies me but to call a stranger and bare my soul. I don’t want to firefight. I want to develop a better understanding of myself and be able to manage my risk and the impact of this horror with increasing independence. Not just be left to deal with it because I’ve exceeded the number of sessions decided by the service. I cannot see how this is patient centred or safe. Where is my wellbeing in all of this? What if I did damage that I can’t take back? What if this now makes me lose faith in all the work that has been done or opt out in the future?  
I also want to comment on failure to attend. I have always had feedback that I am an individual who engages well and wants to make changes. I think it’s exceptionally important to be patient centred and consider the impact of these difficulties on my ability to always attend a session. Sometimes I literally couldn’t move myself from my bed to the bathroom; yet I am “not engaging” if I missed a session on those days. Language like that again actually made my mental health deteriorate. I’m trying desperately but it’s still not good enough. I know that in my own service we consider each circumstance individually and look at that holistically. I feel so disappointed to have not had the same care, especially in a service where fragility, safety and mental health are at the core.  
The services I have accessed are CPN (excellent professional), Psychiatry (difficult professional), Crisis support from various CPNs (very mixed experience) and psychology (nice professional but hugely concerned at the way the service works as described).

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Mackinnon
title: Miscarriage and pregnancy
body:
During 2018 and late 2019 I suffered 4 miscarriages in very close succession. This was an extremely traumatic and worrying time for both myself and my husband. However, the care of the medical staff at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary made the experience a lot easier. I was amazed at the empathy of all the staff within the Rubislaw ward. The care and attention i received within this ward on all occasions was always of the highest standard.  
Similarly, with the services I received within the miscarriage clinic, run initially by Professor Cummings and then Dr. Shetty. Their expertise in this area was second to none and their ability to reassure and comfort really did make a huge difference.  
In January 2020 I found out I was pregnant again. Dr Shetty was available at all times to answer my questions and attended my first scan at 7 weeks where, for the first time, I had a healthy heartbeat. Dr Shetty seem to understand the anxiety this could cause after so many miscarriages and it was a huge comfort to have in the room.  
My care throughout my pregnancy really was fantastic. Even with the Covid pandemic I felt I was treated as a priority. My anxiety after so many miscarriages was high but the team allowed several reassurance scans. This made a huge difference to my pregnancy and really helped me through. The ultrasound team never once made me feel like a burden. Similarly the midwifery team at Inverurie were fantastic and never questioned my numerous concerns about reduced movement, which I believe were driven by anxiety more than anything else.  
In addition, I had access to Shona who really helped on the mental health side. I can honestly say Shona helped me turn a corner with my anxiety throughout my pregnancy. I was extremely anxious and negative at the start, even having to be signed off from work. Shona worked with me on a regular basis and really helped me feel more positive and even excited - something that is hard to feel after so many losses. She helped with everything from dealing with the huge sense of loss from the pregnancies that ended all the way through to helping me deal with anxieties around giving birth and beyond. I didn’t realise there was such a service but her support was invaluable and I know I would have really struggled without her.  
As I’d had a section with my previous daughter I opted for one again. I could not believe how ‘slick’ the process was. From the meeting and guidance with my consultant through to the set up on the day, I was amazed by how efficient everything was. My daughter was born on the morning of the 2nd October 2020 and although I can’t remember the names of the surgeons, midwife and anaesthetists i will always remember their huge level of skill and professionalism. They were all truly fantastic at what they did.  
I opted for one night in hospital which was due to feeling ok to go home. Whilst in hospital all staff were very attentive and dealt with my every need....even cups of tea in the middle of the night.  
As with all my daughters the Inverurie based community midwives were fantastic and even with Covid managed to visit me on a regular basis. My care has now transferred to Gail, health visitor who i already know and find her to be beyond helpful, attentive as well as extremely personable.  
I really do want to take this opportunity to thank everyone involved with both the miscarriages and the pregnancy. I was shocked by how affected I was with the miscarriages and how this affected my mental health. However, having the fantastic support do the NHS really helped me get through an extremely difficult time. I have so much to say thank you for and I really do hope that everyone within the Rubislaw ward, miscarriage clinic, wider maternity unit, Shona, the Inverurie midwifery team, the ARI scanning department and the health visitors really know the value that they add and how appreciated I am of the services they deliver. Thank you.

author: Pablo55
title: I would gladly put myself in their care again.
body:
I recently attended Monklands Hospital Dermatology department. The purpose of this visit was to have a basal cell carcinoma removed.  
I was slightly apprehensive but I need not have worried. The surgeon and nurse who carried out the procedure were very professional and immediately put me at ease. They worked very efficiently as a team and proceeded in very methodical and reassuring way.  
I do not know their names but I would like to thank them most sincerely for looking after me. If I have need to return to Monklands I would gladly put myself in their care again.  
Please pass on my best wishes to them both.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership
MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: Sunshine31
title: Fantastic care.
body:
Fantastic care at University Hospital Wishaw A&E department tonight with my 2 year old after a split head before bedtime.  
Glued and on my way home again within 40mins  
Thank you Nurse Fleming

author: neptunefc56
title: The staff were fantastic.
body: I recently took my younger sister for a procedure at Endoscopy level F at Inverclyde Royal Hospital. This was her first experience of being in hospital for any sort of treatment so she was extremely nervous and upset. The staff on the ward from the moment we arrived were fantastic and gave such caring attention to my sister. A special mention has to go to Cherrie the receptionist and both Nurses Siobhan, Jane & Andrea who made sure she was supported and knew what was happening every step of the way. When we picked her up after her procedure she was calm and proud that she had got through it and that was down to an amazing team. Thank you!

author: pooja
title: Endoscopy investigation
body: I recently visited Glenfield hospital for endoscopy. I wish to record that all the staff involved were very polite, helpful & understanding & treated me just the way anybody should be treated. My thank you to all involved.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: neptunepj89
title: Delighted with the care
body: My husband attended a dermatology appointment yesterday where we expected just to be seen and then given a further appointment, but the doctor referred us to a specialist nurse who carried out the procedure there and then which saved us a lot of hassle. Very happy with the procedure and the safety measure. Delighted with the care.

author: Drum82
title: Our thanks and gratitude to every one of you.
body:
I have just collected my dad from Borders General Hospital after a near 3 week stay due to Covid-19. My dad collapsed on Hogmanay after his oxygen levels dropped and the service received from our NHS from that point was nothing short of brilliant.  
From the SAS crew who attended within 12 mins of me calling them for help to all the doctors, nurses, auxiliaries and all the other staff involved in his care, you all done absolutely amazing work. Dad spent some time in ITU and really wasn’t well at one point but the care he has received has meant my family and myself have been able to get him home today safe and well. My mum will have some work to do to keep up the standard of meals and attention he’s been getting the past three weeks!  
Our thanks and gratitude to every one of you and we will be doing some fundraising as our way of showing our thanks. Keep up the amazing work and know that you are all very special people.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Goldfinger77
title: They work very well together putting you at ease.
body:
Went to Stirling dermatology department for a check on a skin problem which had been worrying me. The doctor who examined me went and sought a second opinion and it was decided that a biopsy should be taken. I was then introduced to David & Lesley who immediately put me at ease explaining the procedure and the risks and after he had a look at the area he felt it might be worth taking the whole area away rather than just a part for the biopsy, so after he had spoken to the doctor it was decided it’s all being removed.  
I would just say if you are nervous about this type of thing hope you get David & Lesley they work very well together putting you at ease with a bit of friendly banter throughout the proceedings which is just what is required to take your mind off the small op and I would also add it was completely painless.

author: Glin
title: Fantastic, friendly and professional treatments
body:
After receiving a few smear tests with abnormal changes I was sent to see Dr Dunmore at Stobhill's gynaecology department. I was extremely nervous having never needed this type of hospital treatment before. I needn't have worried as despite the appointment for a colposcopy being during the covid-19 pandemic I was seen extremely quickly and all of the staff I saw on the day were professional, warm and friendly, putting me at ease.  
I received my results from this quickly and was told I had to go for another treatment. I was far more worried about the loop treatment, it seemed more serious after I'd stupidly read information online (always a bad idea!). I yet again was seen quickly (mid pandemic). Dr Dunmore could not have been more friendly and reassuring which is exactly what I needed to be put at ease. The procedure wasn't bad at all, partly because the nurse (sorry I don't know her name) kept me chatting and was also very warm while Dr Dunmore was extremely professional and therefore knew what to expect in advance. I felt listened to, I didn't want to know what was happening as it was happening and was glad that wasn't a problem.  
I'm hoping I don't need to go back but if I did I'd feel extremely confident that I was in the best possible hands.

author: Rainbow123
title: Autism Diagnosis
body:
My 6 Year old daughter is on the waiting list for a diagnosis for Autism with a PDA profile. We know this is likely to be the main diagnosis due to imput from the school, the educational psychologist and the paediatrician, although there may also be other issues as well. All three have recognised that she is in crisis, frequently telling me she wants to die and doesn't want to exist, she scratches and hits herself. Her GP, the paediatrician and Enable have all put through requests to Camhs for her case to be escalated, I think the educational psychologist has as well. Her GP called them directly to advise she was in crisis and the response she received which she relayed to me was that her and hundreds of others. I understand that there is a long waiting list and that we are on it. I understand that there are hundreds of children who need help. A 6 year old should not be talking about wanting to kill her self!!!  
Without a diagnosis she cannot get the specialised help she clearly needs, she can't get the specialised medication she may need, the school can't get the funding to get the additional personnel support that they need, they have identified that she needs 2 on one support, she has reduced hours and all the sensory equipment they can get their hands on but despite being in P2 there are kids in nursery who recognise more letters and numbers than she can.  
She needs help, we need help and despite all of these agencies trying to arrange and provide that we can't get any further because Camhs will not engage when asked to participate in multi agency meetings to support my child.  
The reason we need a dual pathway assessment is due to her having multiple personas that she inhabits to enable her to find a way to deal with her anxiety, however some of these personas do not get on with her as herself and so they hurt her, and tell her to do things, and exclude her from games. I have had to console a sobbing child who came through from her bedroom with a red face, telling me her imaginary friend slapped her and told her she wasn't allowed to play in her own room. She has been in terror in a shopping centre because she became a little boy whose mum had died and she didn't recognise me as her mum and ran away from me. If this was in the street she could have run in to the road and got knocked over as she has no road sense at the best of times.  
Ultimately I feel let down that we are stuck where we are. Everyone we can get help from is providing all they can but we are basically all waiting on Camhs now.

author: boxwood73
title: Covid vaccination
body:
I visited Meadowgreen health centre on Jan 9th at Jordanthorpe Sheffield 8  
Just to let you know the organisation was excellent, all staff worked extremely hard.  
The visit only took 35 minutes and I was most impressed. Please pass on these comments to all staff involved

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: Rsian89
title: A&E staff at Pilgrim Hospital
body: The ladies on A& E are actual angels. They helped me and my partner at the worst moment of our lives. We went through a miscarriage which caused me to bleed excessively, it was painful and terrifying. They held me as I cried, they allowed my partner to stay by my side and they went above and beyond. They truly deserve the world and I can't thank them enough.

author: milwakimike
title: Hospital experience
body: I was in Craigavon Hospital for 1 week when I fractured my hip and needed DHS Surgery. I was in the Trauma ward. The treatment was good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Appointment with Rapid  Access Clinic
body:
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
[Very happy with 'Reception']

[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rose 33
title: Rapid Access Clinic
body:
My mother attended Daisy Hill Rapid Access Clinic.  
The receptionist,, nurse , Doctor and physiotherapist all who attended my mum were so accommodating, thoughtful, caring and extremely professional.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sick of the NHS
title: Appalling service
body: My wife's smear test results were lost and the surgery did not realise until she phoned to chase the results. She then tried to re-book a test which was re-scheduled 3 times by the practice. When she turned up for her latest appointment, they had forgotten to insert it into their appointment system, sending her away again.

title: Amazing breast screening unit
body: Last week I visited the breast screening unit and wanted to say how fabulous my care was. It was my first visit to the unit and hadn't ever had a mammogram before so was very apprehensive. The radiographer was so welcoming and chatty, putting me at ease from the moment she came to get me from the waiting area. She calmly explained what would happen and what to expect and feel. All the way through the x-ray I felt reassured and left the unit wondering why I'd put it off for so many years out of fear.

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: All round good practice
body: Have been with the practice for a year. Have found the medical staff very good and responsive. The admin side – which is sometimes a weakness in NHS services – is excellent also. And they really seem to be on top of electronic communications. And all this in these difficult covid times! Very impressive.

title: A&E Staff Amazing!
body: I was referred to A&E due to experiencing excruciating pain. All the staff including the staff that sit at the front desk were so lovely and welcoming. The nurses including the Dr’s were so kind and helpful even during these unprecedented times which we are facing. Having been treated at other hospitals in the past, I have to say this hospital really exceeded my expectations. They were so thorough with all the investigations regarding my visit. I was given pain relief while I waited for my blood results to come back, I was also sent for a CT scan during my visit. The Dr also arranged for me to come back the next day for further investigations. Thank you to all the staff, you are all amazing!

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Briliant Service
body: Recently visited practice for Covid vaccination.  Exemplenary service.  Courteous, efficient and friendly staff and volunteers.  Whole experience was a pleasure even in these difficult times.  Thanks to all at Bounds Green Group Practice.

title: Covid 19 Injections
body: The surgery has organised an excellent service in the provision of covid injections. Efficient scheduling, excellent SMS contact, excellent registration and paperwork recording. Smiling nurse, good fact checking and injection Nr. 2 was all completed in 3 minutes!

title: Childrens A&E
body:
Staff really are fantastic here,  it was my second time taking my danger prone four year old son here - who this time had cut his head on the school playground.  
He was terribly upset, all the staff were amazing with him true professionals.  Please make sure they get this feedback I am incredibly grateful.

Only downside was the car parking situation.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I was treated at Salford Royal Hospital on 15 January 2021 for the surgical management of a miscarriage. I was very impressed by the professionalism and caring attitude of all staff and in particular the lady assigned to look after me on the day ward before and after my intervention. Many thanks for your care.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: phoenixfd38
title: Covid vaccine
body: Very professional quick service

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
Been with this practice for 5 years now and they are absolutely brilliant.
Especially now in the times we are in, always a quick response via phone call or text message after leaving a message sent via app. 
All staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Excellent virtual service
body: I was very impressed with my recent virtual GP experience. From reception, GP call back, pharmacy, sample testing and out of hours support I had efficient and effective help. I would recommend this practice for the way they have responded to current covid requirements and hope that the virtual GP features continue in the future

author: louhy7
title: Covid 19 vaccine
body:
I have just been for my Covid 19 vaccination and it was all very well organised and a good experience overall. I felt no pain and it felt like a totally slick operation.  
When I first arrived I was a little confused where to go but that could be due to the fact the building was new to me. I asked staff and although everyone was very busy they were all helpful and pleasant and informed me where to go.  
I never felt rushed or pushed, I got parked easily and as a healthcare worker myself I will be passing my experience on to other colleagues as a positive experience.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Marie81
title: Having covid vaccine
body: Felt welcomed and relaxed on arrival at a very efficient clinic and incredibly friendly staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: hadarsd45
title: Cant get through to AMU ward
body: My mum was taken onto this ward yesterday all day we've been trying to get in touch for an update on how she is. No one ever answers the phone just either letting it ring out or picking it up and putting phone straight back down. I think its bad enough that were not allowed to visit without keeping us informed on mum's condition feel so frustrated right n desperately worried about her im at my wits end.

author: pilingsqt76
title: Help I received
body: My family and I was in a bad situation struggling for food, I asked rebecca who is my support worker for help and recieved it the next day, also at the same time I explained to rebecca about my housing situation and she got the housing to ring me also. Which I am very thankful for and like to thank rebecca and cgl.

author: limecoffee22
title: Hysteroscopy at Solihull Hospital
body:
The staff at Solihull hospital were very patient and kind. I had to attend on two separate appointments and was, by the second visit, more anxious than I realised. The Drs were patient and explained what they were doing (and why) and also made it clear that I was in control of what happened, if I felt in any discomfort. The nurses were very kind and helped me when I felt quite vulnerable; I felt looked after and treated with respect. I just wanted to say thank you and to re-assure other women not to worry about this outpatient procedure.  
[Very happy with 'Nurses']  
[Very happy with 'Being listened to']  
[Unsure about 'Doctor']

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Enjayel
title: Autism assessment with Advanced Autism Practitioner
body:
I concluded my autism assessment and follow up in December last year and I thought I'd share my experience of the service. The assessment was very thorough and I found Alison to be a skilled practitioner, adept at listening and capturing the nuanced information necessary to make an accurate diagnosis. I found Alison to be very personable and easy to talk to. The subsequent report that Alison produced was very accurate and the whole experience has allowed me to understand myself better and to better cope with my condition moving forward.  
Aside from the inevitable pressures on the service and resultant delays caused by our current times, I couldn't have asked for a better experience. Harnessing the video conferencing technology to be able to continue to deliver this essential service was a great idea and in general the VC was very reliable. We did encounter the occasional minor technical gremlin but having used many VC services in my working life, this tends to come with the territory!  
Having tried to obtain this type of assistance before moving to Scotland, I have to say the service here is much better than in England. Thank you Alison for all your help, it's much appreciated.

author: DISTRESSED MUM TO BE
title: I was told I couldn't come into the building
body: I am 8 weeks pregnant and was bleeding was told by out of hours gp to go to a&e. I went to the ulster to be told I can't come into the building due to covid. Was send out to the carpark in the dark, alone and bleeding with a number to call for obs and gynae. Stood waiting for them to call me back to tell me they cannot see me and I will have to wait to be seen at early pregnancy unit 5 days later. At present I am still bleeding still waiting to be seen and still left with no idea id my baby is alive or not. This is despicable way to be treated

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Super practice
body: I like the practice as all the staff is very good and the Doctors are very professional and they do listen to the problems and treat patients with care.

title: Very efficient getting my Covid vaccine
body: The practice were well staffed and equipped in providing the vaccine to me and my team. Very impressed with their efficiency.

title: Excellent
body: Excellent, even in these Covid times, from the arrival at reception through to the surgical procedure and following aftercare all the staff were caring and helpful.

title: Great practice
body:
I visited this surgery and was really pleased with the help and advice I received.
I had a scan at hospital in 2020 to no avail.
I was examined at silverdale, diagnosed and recieving treatment. I cannot praise this practice enough 🙂😊
Massive Thank you to all, one great team.

title: Fantastic practice, professional team
body: I have been with three medical practice for over ten years, they have always been helpful professional and I have the utmost trust in them. Their new online system works incredibly well and aids accessibility and I have used this very satisfactorily twice recently, I had a response within a very short time frame sorting out my issues immediately. They are working very hard during this time and I am incredibly grateful to them.

title: Superb practice.
body:
I am always amazed at how far, especially during the current crisis, that the Doctors and all staff will go out of their way to try and accommodate patient needs.
This really is a Community Health Service.

title: covid vaccination well organised
body: Attended to get the covid vaccine, reception staff very helpful. System was well run with constant cleaning of seats etc.  Had to wait because there seemed to be about 5 people doing the vaccination and calling for next person.  Attended with husband. Were called together and given vaccine by a female Dr, no fuss.  Hope the second jab goes as smoothly as this.

title: Outstanding Practice
body:
I filled in a form online to request a GP appointment and I’m less than 20 minutes a GP called me and arranged a referral for an urgent scan. 
The service was outstanding!!

title: Amazing staff, safe envitonment
body:
I attended for a colonoscopy today, I was a little apprehensive about potential risks associated with the COVID-19 Virus and slso a little nervous sbout the procedure.
On entering the hospital I was immediately reassured by the measures put in place to reduce potential virus spread, the 'security' personnel who greeted people entering the hospital were thorough, polite and approachable. The staff in the Endoscopy suite from receptionists, nurses,technicians  doctors to housekeeping were extremely professional, reassuring and friendly. Making my experience a great deal less stressful than I had anticipated. I would be impressed at any time, but given the extremely difficult situation hospitals and the staff are facing at the moment, I can only say everyone is truly amazing.  THANK you .

title: Outstanding care
body:
I had to go to A&E today. I was obviously nervous about going to the hospital given the current situation but I can say the care and service I received was absolutely first class! From the minute I arrived to when I left, I cannot fault a single member of staff. Receptionists, nurses, radiographers, doctors, just everyone was so caring and attentive. It turned out that I had broken my ankle so it was well worth going but considering how much pressure the medical profession is under at the moment, I felt completely safe in their care and could not ask for more!
Well done everyone at Frimley Park. You are all the reason why our NHS is world class!!!! 
Thank you for looking after me :)

title: Thankyou
body: Thanks to those who looked after my 89 year old auntie today, she had fallen at home and sustained a head injury. Auntie told me all the staff were so lovely and kind, the A&E dept she described as calm and she felt very reassured and well looked after,      Many thanks to the team today.

title: wonderful care x
body: Just like to say how great lovely and professional all the covid 19 care team were tonight when i took my mother for her over 80 ,s inoculation , from the beginning to the end it was carried out with great care and efficiency .Well done to every one involved , thankyou to all key workers xx

title: Great practice
body:
Very cordial staff, doctors thoroughly professional, excellent service.
I would highly recommend this Surgery.

title: helpfull and professional
body: been with this surgery since the 70s probably longer than the doctors,if you phone early you can always get an appointment,reception staff have always been helpfull,doctors and nurses are lovely,if you need to be refered you are,quickly, never had a problem with prescriptions either.

title: Positive experience
body: I recently had a knee replacement at the Park hospital. I was extremely worried about the operation before going in. Indeed I lost much sleep prior to admission. I can honestly say the operation turned out to be a very positive experience. Every person I came into contact with was pleasant, friendly, professional and caring. I was kept informed throughout my stay and could not fault the care I received. Inspite of the added complication of covid restrictions I don't think I could have felt safer or better looked after. Thank you to everyone involved in my care.

title: Brilliant surgery, highly recommended
body: I wanted to thank all the staff at the Vale practice for the wonderful care I (and my husband and children) have received over the years.  I've always been able to access the help I need, in a timely and efficient manner.  The staff are professional and courteous, and the facilities are always clean.  Even during the Covid-19 pandemic the surgery has remained open and delivered the same high standard of care.  Thanks again.

title: Great service !!
body:
Attended the practice for my Covid 19 vaccination. Can’t praise them enough!!
A* service. The whole experience was well run & organised which made me feel totally at ease throughout my appointment.

title: Friendly and efficient
body: All staff were friendly and helpful, from the consultation and on the day of the operation staff were lovely right from entering the building. Any questions-silly as they might have seemed to me were answered professionally. The nurses who looked after me were super. Very caring and understanding. Thank you!

title: Brilliant hospital and staff
body: I went in for day surgery. Having not had any surgery before I was very anxious. Staff were absolutely brilliant, so kind and reassuring. Made me feel so much better. Lovey hospital (as far as hospitals go!) Thank you

title: Well done!!!
body: I have been a patient at this practice for years and I am thrilled that the service is still good.All the admin staff and receptionists are polite and nice , there is one receptionist with blonde hair and she is always very helpful.Appointments can be booked with ease and the doctors are always amazing  . Given all the limitations of our NHS I am grateful for the care I receive at The Practice 188. Well done people.

title: Brilliant service
body: My appointment was early, and my doctor was very friendly and easy to talk to. He listened well and gave clear and easy to understand advice. The appointment went really well!

title: Well looked after!
body: I came in by ambulance after having having a painful miscarriage and was put on women’s health ward where I had surgery. I can not thank ALL staff I came into contact with, the paramedics, HCA’s, Nurses, theatre nurses and surgeons too many to remember and name but every single one has made my experience less traumatic and I’ve not felt so alone during these times. Just a thank you from myself, not that it seems enough but I really appreciate all you have done for me.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have been with this practice since 1996 
The reception staff are kind and helpful 
The standard of care from the doctors and nurses is fantastic 
They have provided really good care to me and my family during these difficult times - huge thank you to the whole team

title: Fallowfield Medical Centre
body: Receptionists are very helpful and comforting. Doctors are good at identifying problems and helping with them.

title: Great practice
body: Want to say well done to the team at marine surgery today. I attended for my COVID vaccine and they were efficient and well organised - all staff keen to help and ensure as many people were vaccinated safely as possible. Thank you.

title: Very helpful reception staff
body: I called this morning about making an appointment for medication and i was made to feel very comfortable and have been given chance to speak to a gp today. Given the circumstances with coronavirus i was anxious about making appointments over the phone but the lady i spoke to on the phone made me feel much better

author: Feloniousgru
title: Exemplary care
body:
My Mum was recently cared for on Beacon ward during her final days but has been a regular at the Beacon Centre for the last 11 years as she battled ovarian cancer. She has always received exemplary care but during this last admission I witnessed first hand the staff going above and beyond as they tended to Mum in the midst of a global pandemic. The amazing staff cared for and supported us all during one of the worst periods of our lives and we will never be able to thank them enough.  
Special thanks to special people - Dr Cattell, Dr Barlow, doctors Jonathan and Chris (such a handsome chap! ), Sophie the palliative care nurse, nurses Mandy, Sophie, Amelia, Michele, Sarah and Viv, HCAs Tanya, Clare and Sarah, student nurse Aston, the lovely receptionists and ward assistants and of course ‘Sally from the valley! ’ Mum was not always an easy customer but hopefully she is a memorable one. Stay wonderful, with love from the family of Jo xx

title: The Perfect Practice
body: Visited my practice yesterday and as always, it was so nice to see so many friendly faces. I had a great appointment with my GP who reassured me and set things in motion for extra tests. I came away feeling confident about everything. Also, everything was in place to feel safe and comfortable during this time.

title: Great organisation
body: I went for me COVID vaccine and it was extremely well organised. Staff was polite and explained everything. Everyone was sanitising and made me feel safer

title: Professional, efficient, empathetic
body: I was apprehensive and anxious about this investigation. The overlay of covid adds extra concern. The team were all kind and efficient. Despite it being an unpleasant procedure - it was conducted with complete professionalism and empathy. I was given good explanations at every step of the process and immediate feedback. I am aware that the team are having to cope with additional Covid 19 measures and will have friends and colleagues who are being affected. Well done for keeping operating the unit with such professionalism. THANK YOU.

title: Fantastic Team
body:
What a fantastic team. Excellent treatment. I felt safe, and very much put at ease.
All steps were and are  taken to minimise the risk of COVID. 
Thank you

title: Great Practice
body: I attended to have the Covid vaccine. The service was efficient, safe and running on time. Staff were very polite.

title: THIS CARE HOME HAS WONDERFULLY CARING STAFF
body: The staff are doing a wonderful job and are working hard to support residents and their families through the pandemic. The home is run by a truly caring manager who is dedicated to delivering quality care to her residents. whilst activities currently exclude trips and visits in the local community the activity staff are using innovative ways to stay in touch. A visitors pod has been set up to enable safe visiting. A clean and lovely home.

title: Excellent service
body: I visited the Covid Vaccination centre today & wanted to say how extremely well organised it is with fabulous, welcoming and approachable staff. I was quite nervous due to battling with myself about actually having the vaccine, should I, shouldn't I, but they were fantastic and answered every question I asked. Well Done Everyone! Flawless from beginning to end. Remember to stay safe yourselves 👍🏼🥰

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic experience at the practice
body:
I visited the practice and received a covid vaccine. The staff were so kind and helpful. I can only try to imagine how hard they worked to deliver the vaccines to so many people.
Thank you all so much.

title: Excellent practice
body: In these challenging times our experience at Dealtree GP surgery has been really positive. From the initial phone calls to the speed of response from the doctors we cannot fault them. Every time we have had reason in recent months to call, the staff have been extremely helpful and always pleasant. We have never felt that we are wasting their time or are an inconvenience and have always come away with a positive experience, whether that be a doctor’s telephone appointment leading on occasions to a face to face appointment or simply useful information. Thank you Dealtree for what you are all doing in these extraordinarily difficult days. Keep up the good work!

title: Help and support
body:
Monday 18th contacted surgery re possibility of me having cystitis.
Explained to reception, nurse phoned me back in 5 minutes. She asked me to supply urine sample and said she would speak with gp
Approximately 40 minutes later I received a text from the Community Pharmacy to collect medication needed. Super efficient.
When you are unwell it is so nice to have a comforting word particularly when you are on your own. I had that from both the nurse and the chemist. Thank you

author: briyt66
title: Unprofessional behaviour
body: When my mother was admitted to the hospital I found the staff to be utterly unprofessional, they gave no information about my mum and when I phoned about her I was literally shouted at down the phone twice. Next day I went up there to see my mum and to tell her what happened one staff member started to be verbally abusive towards me and also refused to leave the bed and give any privacy. I asked them several times to leave but they refused and started shouting, became abusive, called me names and called for security. I felt that this was totally unnecessary and I was prepared to stand my ground. My poor ill mum asked them to leave her alone with her son but to no avail, the junior doctor was also rude and the same nurse who refused to leave the bottom of the bed made hurtful comments even though I believe they were aware I had depression and anxiety. I felt that they were taking advantage of my mum with all the drugs she was on. Disgusting.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Positive experience
body: Needed help today (rare occurrence) and after short wait a friendly, efficient receptionist took my call. She arranged for a paramedic to call me back. This person is worth their weight in gold. So friendly, sympathetic and helpful and had a prescription made ready for collection later this morning. A positive experience and I feel confident I am in good hands should I need any further help which is so reassuring. Thank you so much. Great service in these trying times

title: Vivid 19
body: Writing on behalf of my mother who has just recently had the vaccination jab at Salisbury cathedral. Excellent service all round, well organised and commendable performance from all concerned.Thank you.

title: Quick response.
body: I hade great experience all the time, doctors are friendly & reports responses regarding good, they take care by texting us thank you.

title: Great practice
body: I had a very good experience. The appointment was welcome in view of the difficult situation throughout the NHS. The hospital was easy to get to for me. Parking just outside the hospital was easy and convenient. I was seen by the Consultant ahead of my appointment time which made the whole experience even better.

title: Rude receptionist
body: My partner was dealt with in a most unsatisfactory manner today and it’s not good enough. The receptionist on duty today needs to taught how to deal with people in a respectful, polite manner.

title: Excellent focus on understanding the patient's…
body:
Thank you everyone at the surgery - from the receptionist; to the mental health nurse; all the way to the GP. 

Patient, professional, empathetic - 5 stars all round - inspite of these challenging and trying times.

title: Great nurses
body: I felt the nurse listened to all my concerns and did her best to help. She treated me as a whole person not just one aspect, which is so important in my view.

title: Clockwork precision
body: My husband received his Pfizer jab this morning in the cathedral. We walked straight in, he was inoculated bang on time and, after the obligatory 15 mins wait in the nave listening to beautiful organ music, we headed for home. Very well organised, thank you.

title: Vaccination of Covid Vaccicne
body: Hi . I was given a 10 minute slot for the vaccination. I went exactly on time for the vaccination. As I entered I could see a large number of people seated and standing waiting for vaccinations in one room. I certainly did not accept this. They were all wearing face masks but difficult to socially distance. I was nearly one hour in there to get vaccinated and very worried. I think they have booked too many people into these 10 minute slots -many more than they could vaccinate in that time. This I think is not acceptable. There were others who were concerned and even complained. But there was nothing anyone could do.But I must say that the staff were excellent and no complaints about them.

title: Great practice
body: Went for my vaccination this morning, want to say thank you to all the staff for their friendly and efficient service.  Gold Stars, 🤗

title: Jewel in the community
body: Had letter for my flu Jab, called and arranged so quickly under Covid protocols. One way system in and out for injection , practice is always clean but was even more sanitized . This area are very lucky to have this group of People caring for us.

title: Fantastic support
body: My elderly neighbours family live a long distance away, we have been doing her shopping and ringing the Practice when she has medical needs, the receptionist’s and the Doctors have been really helpful and supportive, I really don’t know what I would have done without them and can’t thank then enough

title: Great service
body: Initially, I spoke with reception staff who said I did need a telephone consult with a GP.  The GP called the same day and made an appointment for two days' time.  Staff were welcoming with excellent Covid-safe systems in place.  Really impressed with all staff and GP - I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this practice.  Thank you.

title: Medication review
body: I had a review today, the doctor I spoke to was really supportive and was very informative, they had me feel at ease. Than you so much. We are quick to make a complete, but never give praise. Again thank you.

title: Good
body: I had reason to call the practice today and was told a Dr would call today now I have had a lot of problems before when told I would get a call but on this occasion I was called within a hour the Dr was very thorough and sent the antibiotics straight down to the chemist so on this occasion I would like to thank the Dr.for there help.

title: Grateful for this practice
body: My husband phoned the surgery as we were both diagnosed with COVID,I was feeling poorly he had to keep ringing but eventually got through,there advice was to phone 111 which we did then we got a phone call back from the surgery and a doctor spoke to me and advised I go to the Reading Hub,as I was getting ready another phone call came from the Respiratory Doctor at the hub he asked lots of questions of my symptoms,satisfied I didn’t need hospital treatment so all in all I was glad of the service I received so a big thank you to Woosehill medical centre and to Reading Hub.

title: Always reliably good service
body: Have never been let down by this surgery. They're efficient and caring. Despite being busy all staff are always pleasant and go out of their way to help, showing patience and explaining procedures. I've been with this surgery for over 30 years and would not like to change.

title: Some rude reception staff
body: Some of the reception staff are great. Others are rude and unhelpful. I was trying to ensure my prescription was refilled before Xmas and I had had issues with the automated ordering service in the past: I have a mental health condition. I was told I was “blocking” the line and then was hung up on. When I complained about this the practice closed ranks and didn’t take my complaint seriously. My trust in the practice is completely shattered. There is another practice in Berwick (Well Close) so I am moving to them instead

title: Excellent Reception staff
body: Spoke to one of the reception staff tuesday afternoon who listened to me attentively and sorted out my issue. Very happy with the customer care i received.

title: Excellent care
body: I was admitted due to a head injury.  Although the staff were rushed off their feet the care and support they gave me was second to none. I was moved onto AAU after  a while where the excellent service carried on. Well done guys you remained patient and caring even when things became hectic. Keep up the good work and stay safe

title: excellent management of corona vaccination…
body: Today my husband went in for his vaccination.  I was chatting outside and told someone that my appointment was on the following day. The staff member marshalling patients over heard my comment and came over to ask if I would like to have mine at the same time - she then made arrangements for me to be vaccinated.  This was very thoughtful and made perfect sense.  The whole service was efficiently managed, taking good care of everyone's concerns and safety.  Overall a good experience.  Well done to all concerned.

title: Fantastic practise
body: My medical condition is complex and requires constant care and review. The GP and Drs at the practise have put in phenomenal effort to keep me stable and going. They are regularly in touch with the various Specialist Drs treating me at 2-3 Hospitals. My tests and prescriptions are all done promptly and always at first call. I thank them and all support staff at this wonderful Practise, for taking such good care.  My tests and prescriptions are all done promptly and always at first call. I thank all at this wonderful Practise, for taking such good care.

title: Brilliant Practice
body: The staff and Doctors at Pinner Rd Surgery are all excellent. The service is outstanding. Everyone is compassionate and helpful. We are totally blessed to have Pinner Rd Surgery as our Primary care provider. Thankyou

title: Fantastic staff
body: I had a spinal epidural all staff are fantastic . Kind and caring and so reassuring they  are doing a fantastic job  thankyou to you all

title: Wonderful, clear consultation
body: So pleased to report that my consultation was handled thoroughly and information regarding my diagnosis and follow up plan explained clearly and professionally. You are brilliant. Thank you.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
